configure.p: A Composite actor is an aggregation of actors. It may have a local director that is responsible for executing the contained actors. A Composite actor with a local director is called an opaque actor. Composite actors do not require a local director. Composite actors with no local director "inherit" the director from the containing workflow and are called non-opaque.

To create a composite actor, drag and drop the Composite actor onto the Workflow canvas. Right-click the actor and select Open Actor from the drop-down menu. A new Kepler application window will open for designing the composite.
